alert.note: Alert for Emery (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 12:33PM MDT until June 29 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Trail Mountain burn scar in... Northwestern Emery County in central Utah... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 1233 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Huntington Creek drainage, specifically Rilda and Meetinghouse Canyons. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntington Creek drainage, specifically Rilda and Meetinghouse Canyons. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
